identity.name: E1 Industrial
identity.mission: Create a raw, functional, and high-precision manufacturing interface. No fluff, just data and control.
principles: Data over Decoration: Every pixel must serve a purpose.
High Contrast: Visibility in low-light factory conditions is paramount.
Tactile Feedback: Buttons should feel like physical switches.
Grid Precision: Everything aligns perfectly, like a machined part.

typography.installation: Import via Google Fonts in index.css: @import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=JetBrains+Mono:wght@400;500;700&family=Oswald:wght@400;500;700&display=swap');

strategies: Dashboard: Grid of 7 columns (one per department) for Admin view.
Staff View: Single focused column with 'Next Up' and 'In Progress' sections.
Borders: Use 'divide-y divide-zinc-800' for lists, 'border border-zinc-800' for containers.

buttons.style: rounded-none uppercase tracking-widest font-bold text-xs h-10 px-6 transition-all active:scale-95

variants.outline: border border-zinc-700 text-zinc-300 hover:border-yellow-500 hover:text-yellow-500 bg-transparent

inputs.style: rounded-none border-zinc-800 bg-zinc-950 focus:ring-1 focus:ring-yellow-500 focus:border-yellow-500 font-mono text-sm

badges.style: rounded-none px-2 py-0.5 text-[10px] uppercase tracking-wider font-bold border

visual_enhancers.textures: Use a subtle 'scanline' or 'noise' overlay on the main background if possible, or keep it clean matte black.
visual_enhancers.lighting: Use 'shadow-[0_0_15px_rgba(234,179,8,0.1)]' on active elements to simulate LED glow.
visual_enhancers.borders: Double borders or 'bracket' style borders for key metrics.

media.usage: Images should be desaturated (grayscale) by default and reveal color on hover (transition-all duration-500 grayscale hover:grayscale-0).

motion.hover_effects: translate-x-1 for list items, scale-105 for cards (subtle)
motion.loading: Blinking cursor effect or simple progress bar (no spinning circles)

accessibility.contrast: Ensure all text is at least Zinc-400 on Zinc-900 backgrounds.
accessibility.focus_states: Visible yellow ring offset-2 for keyboard navigation.
accessibility.aria: All status icons must have aria-labels.

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. INSTALL FONTS: Add the Google Fonts import to index.css immediately.
2. CONFIGURE TAILWIND: Update tailwind.config.js to extend the font family with 'Oswald' and 'JetBrains Mono'.
3. OVERRIDE SHADCN: Go into /components/ui/button.jsx, card.jsx, etc., and force the 'rounded-none' and 'border-zinc-800' styles. Do not rely on default Shadcn styles.
4. BUILD LAYOUT: Create a 'DepartmentBoard' component that takes a 'department' prop. If department is 'admin', show all 7 columns. If specific, show only that column.
5. STATE MANAGEMENT: Use a simple context or state to track orders moving from column to column.
6. THEME: Force 'dark' class on the html/body tag. This app does not have a light mode.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. In frontend design, this creates what users call the 'AI slop' aesthetic. Avoid this: make creative, distinctive frontends that surprise and delight.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
